summary: This is an email exchange between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding the Epstein case, specifically about responding to a letter from 'Jay' and inquiring whether Judge Davis has selected a lawyer for Epstein. It shows internal coordination within the prosecution team.

persons.name: Davis
persons.context: Mentioned as the judge who may have selected a lawyer for Epstein in the case.

persons.name: Jay
persons.context: Author of a letter to which the U.S. Attorney's Office is preparing a response.

events.title: Email exchange about Epstein case response
events.description: Internal email discussion within the U.S. Attorney's Office about preparing a response to a letter from 'Jay' and inquiring about Judge Davis selecting a lawyer for Epstein.

keyFacts: Internal U.S. Attorney's Office email shows coordination on the Epstein case in November 2007.
The prosecution team was preparing a response to a letter from someone named 'Jay' regarding the Epstein case.
There was uncertainty about whether Judge Davis had selected a lawyer for Epstein at that time.
The document shows ongoing legal proceedings and communication within the prosecution team during the Epstein investigation.
